message: The dragon turns around and gives you a burning look.
choices: You call out to it, trying to calm it down.
You stand your ground, ready to face it head-on.
You turn around screaming like a mandrake.

outcomes.message: The dragon is upset by your attempt to communicate and lashes out.
The dragon respects your bravery and prepares to fight you fairly. He swipes at you and scratches you, but without causing too much damage.
The dragon is confused by your reaction and hesitates.

message: The dragon prepares to breathe fire at you.
choices: You cast the Protego spell while attempting to shield yourself.
You dodge behind a nearby rock, trying to avoid the flames.
You cast a spell trying to extinguish the flames.

outcomes.message: - "Protego!" you shout, raising your wand just in time to partially block the dragon's fiery breath.
You narrowly avoid the flames, but the heat singes your clothes and skin.
- "Aguamenti!" you shout, successfully dousing the dragon's flames with a powerful jet of water.

message: The dragon is momentarily stunned from your last move.
choices: You seize the opportunity to launch a powerful attack.
You take a moment to catch your breath and assess the situation.
You summon a wild Pikkachu to distract the dragon.

outcomes.message: You channel all your energy into a single, devastating spell that hits the dragon squarely.
You take a deep breath, steadying yourself for the next phase of the battle.

The Pikkachu appears out of nowhere, causing the dragon to turn its attention away from you. The dragon raises its right paw and crushes Pikachu like a mere fly. But you've gained the time you needed and cast Incendio directly at the creature's rear end!

message: The dragon rises into the air, moving its huge wings in an impressive manner.
choices: You aim a spell at the dragon's wings to try and bring it down.
You prepare to defend yourself from an aerial attack.
You summon a flock of enchanted birds to harass the dragon.

outcomes.message: - "Confringo!" Your spell hits the dragon's wing, causing it to lose balance.
You brace yourself as the dragon swoops down, narrowly avoiding its claws and teeth.
The enchanted birds swarm around the dragon, distracting it and causing it to lose focus.

message: The Hungarian Horntail soars high into the air but is suddenly stopped by the chain holding it back. Enraged, it lunges at you.
choices: You pull out a piece of meat and try to throw it into the crowd to distract the monster.
You cast “Bombarda” on the dragon's snout.
You call your Nimbus 2000.

outcomes.message: You throw the meat with all your strength, and the dragon turns its head to snatch it, giving you a chance to strike. But there's the crowd! The dragon accidentally eat one or two spectators. Oops. Severus Snape PAS CONTENT and immediately casts a spell on you: "Crucio!" You feel a sharp pain in your back.
- "Bombarda!" you shout, and the spell hits the dragon's snout, causing it to reel back in pain.
You summon your magic broomstick, and with a swift maneuver, you manage to get close enough to the dragon to strike it.

message: The dragon performs a triple backflip followed by a 360 and prepares to strike with its tail.
choices: You cast “Stupefy” to try and stun the dragon.
You roll to the side to avoid the tail strike.
You cast “Rictusempra” to make the dragon laugh.

outcomes.message: - "Stupefy!" Your spell hits the dragon, but it only throws it off balance for a few seconds, and its attack is no less violent.
You roll to the side just in time, avoiding the dragon's tail strike.
- "Rictusempra!" The dragon starts laughing uncontrollably at your spell, giving you an opening.

message: The dragon circles around you at full speed, spewing jets of flame.
choices: You shoot a jet of flames with your wand, trying to counter the dragon's flames.
You use your wand to create a whirlwind to divert the flames.
You try to cut through the flames.

outcomes.message: - "Incendio!" you shout, and your flames collide with the dragon's, creating a spectacular fire explosion.
- "Ventus!" You create a whirlwind that diverts the dragon's flames away from you but starts a fire in the crowd. Oops.
You manage to cut through the flames, but the heat is intense and drains your energy. Your spell only grazes the dragon.

message: The Hungarian Horntail stomps his feet on the ground, agaced by your performance.
choices: You perform a dramatic gesture with your wand, worthy of Lord Voldemort prime.
You shout 'It's leviosa, not leviosaaa!' just to annoy it further.
You cast 'Reparo' on a nearby rock for no reason.

outcomes.message: Your theatrical performance momentarily disorients the dragon, who no longer knows which way to turn.
The dragon becomes offended by your tone and roars straight into your face.
The repaired rock impresses nobody except perhaps Professor Flitwick. The dragon ignores you entirely but it swings its tail at you and sends you flying more than 20 meters through the air.

message: The dragon suddenly hiccups tiny fireballs like a drunken Hufflepuff after too many Butterbeers.
choices: You attempt to soothe it with a lullaby learned from Hagrid.
You cast 'Protego Maxima' to shield yourself with a magical umbrella.
You cast 'Episkey' on the dragon's throat.

outcomes.message: It seems the dragon is deaf... It doesn't react and you finish burned like a toast. The crowd laughs at your foolish failure
- "Protego Maxima!" you shout, erecting a magical umbrella that deflects the tiny fireballs.
- "Episkey"! The spell soothes the dragon's hiccups. It exhales softly… then sneezes a massive fireball that misses you by inches.

message: The dragon attempts to sit on you to crush you under its massive weight.
choices: You take a step to the side.
You cast 'Wingardium Leviosa' on the dragon.
You pretend to be asleep to confuse it.

outcomes.message: You step aside just in time and lets you time to cast 'Expelliarmus' on the Horntail.
- "Wingardium Leviosa!" you shout, and the dragon is lifted off the ground momentarily, giving you a chance to strike. But it costs you a lot of energy.
Pretending to be asleep wasn't your best idea... The dragon flattens you like a pancake.

message: The dragon sneezes, covering you in burning snot.
choices: You cast on yourself 'Scourgify' to clean off the mucus.
You cast on yourself 'Glacius' to freeze the mucus before it burns you entirely.
You throw a piece of inflamed mucus back at the dragon using 'Repulso'.

outcomes.message: - "Scourgify!" you shout, successfully cleaning off the burning mucus.
- "Glacius!" you shout, freezing the mucus on your skin. But then you cannot move properly for a few moments! Until the dragon breathes fire at you.
- "Repulso!" you shout, and the piece of burning mucus flies back at the dragon, hitting it squarely in the face. Who knew dragons were sensitive against snot attacks?

message: The dragon begins a strange mating dance. You're unsure whether to feel flattered or horrified.
choices: You applaud politely.
You try your own seduction dance.
You run away shouting that you're already in a relationship.

outcomes.message: The dragon seems to appreciate your polite applause and hesitates, giving you an opening.
Your dance completely confuses the dragon, which begins to purr and stop fighting. You take advantage of this to cast the spell 'Abracadabite' right in its face!
The dragon is very disappointed to learn you are already taken. It growls and lashes out at you in frustration.

message: The dragon stops fighting, seemingly waiting for epic music celebrating its glory.
choices: You summon an entire symphony orchestra to play 'Hedwig's Theme'.
You don't mind and cast 'Silencio' on the Horntail.
You cast 'Sonorus' on yourself and narrate the battle like Lee Jordan.

outcomes.message: Your tune inspires the dragon, who spreads its wings dramatically before attacking, leading to a dramatic clash.
The dragon halts, confused, giving you a brief opening to strike.
Your majestic commentary enchants the crowd—and distracts the dragon long enough for a clean hit.

message: You are suddendly seeing you flying through the air, after the dragon jumped on the ground, in a perfect imitation of a kangaroo.
choices: You summon your personal Hippogriff to catch you.
You do nothing because you're enjoying the flight.
You shout 'Accio Ground!' hopping to bring the ground closer to you.

outcomes.message: Your Hippogriff, sad to see you in great danger, catches you and quickly strikes the dragon from above before landing safely.
Enjoying the flight, you cast 'Expelliarmus' on the dragon, but therefore you crash painfully on the ground.
Did you really think it could work??? It seems that you were rocked too close to the wall (literally speaking). You approaches the ground faster than a TGV and crash terribly.
